simple.net

Class Uri

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.net.Uri

  • public final class Uri
extends java.lang.Object
    More accurately parses the parts of a URI. This will even parse partial URI's with no problem.
    The example URIs that will be used:
    http://train.rail.com/georgia/augusta.php?id=1654#schedule
    urn:isbn:0-395-36341-1

    Created: Nov 5, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultScheme

        public static void setDefaultScheme(java.lang.String scheme)
        Sets the default scheme to use when a URI starting with '//' is encountered. The default default scheme is blank. Updating the default scheme is not retroactive.
        Parameters:
        scheme - The default scheme

      • getDefaultScheme

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultScheme()
        Returns:
        The default scheme

      • trimFragment

        public final java.lang.String trimFragment()
        Trims the fragment off the URI. Useful for keeping a list of pages already read. Query is kept since this can affect the page's content.
        Returns:
        The URI minus the fragment.

      • trimTrailing

        public final java.lang.String trimTrailing()
        Trims the fragment and query off the URI. Useful for keeping a list of pages already read where the query has no effect.
        Returns:
        The URI minus the fragment.

      • escapeSmart

        public static final java.lang.String escapeSmart(java.lang.String part)
        Escapes all reserved characters. Checks for valid escape sequences to avoid escaping an escape character. If the escape sequence is invalid then the escape is escaped.
        Parameters:
        part - The string to escape
        Returns:
        the escaped string
